name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Hotel Noble House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel looks very nice and fresh when viewing pictures of it but it's not. Sure, some stuff is brand new and all room's got some nice wallpaper on one of the walls but the mix with the old stuff (bathroom, doors, some furniture, etc) makes it feel cheap and a bit strange.
reviews.title: NOT a design hotel...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most of the rooms (all?) have a view of either an inner court (containing about 15 buzzing air conditioners) or the street with Malmö's ugliest building. Despite the air conditioners, our room was hot like a sauna (I guess they use them for the lobby and the restaurant only).
reviews.title: Perfectly alright

reviews.text: Only one elevator was in use during our stay and the other one broke down one of the days. Also, the toilet wasn't cleaned properly which for me is a big no-no.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great price

reviews.text: The only reason for staying here is the location (but there are other, better alteratives if that's your major concern). If you still wanna stay here, make sure to get a room on the top floors (4-6).
reviews.title: Very good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel really left me blank. Its location is great, just minutes from the central station. The staff is friendly but not overtly warm. We visited for two nights during a renovation.
reviews.title: Right in town

reviews.text: Great internet deal for family of 4 in a family room that turned out to be an above average junior suite. Suite was spacious, tastefully decorated, clean and luxurious. Two televisions were included which was a pleasant surprise, this little touch took the stress out of taking 2 children on a weekend break with spare time in the evenings. A cuddly toy was placed on one of the beds for the younger child to cuddle at night, with strict instructions to leave it for the next child. My daughter took great care to follow the instructions and was delighted to look after him for 2 days. Tea/Coffee facilities in the room. The only downside was the lack of air con - very hot in malmo last week. Reception staff were helpful and pleasant to deal with. Breakfast was excellent, typical scandanavian spread in nice open dining room. Internet access available in lobby. The most pleasant surprise was the central location of the hotel, located on Gustav Adolf torg and one street from Lilla Torg which is great for evening dining and people watching. Hotel was a 5 minute walk to central station.
reviews.title: This hotel is a gem in the heart of Malmo

likes.liked: — The location, the quality of the hotel and the little touches they included to improve our stay

description: Stay at our four star hotel in Malmö City, close to the restaurants at Lilla Torg and the best shopping areas just outside the door.The style in our rooms is modern and cozy with different wallpapers, beautiful art and fully tiled bathrooms. Our mascot, Turbo the dog and his puppies keep you company in every room.When the feet are tired after a whole day of shopping, you can relax with a cocktail in the bar or enjoy a meal in our restaurant on lobby level.If you wish to relax a while, you can use the sauna located on the 6th floor or treat yourselt with a beauty treatments at a nearby beauty school. You can borrow both bicycle and walking equipment at front desk, so explore the city! Take a ride to all the nearby parks, the beautiful beach or famous buildning Turning Torso.The hotel is eco-labelled, smoke free and offers complimentary wireless internet access throughout.
